{{Quote|Our home, Greywater Watch, is no castle like you'll ever see. And seeing it once does not mean you'll ever find it again. For Greywater Watch... moves.|[[Meera Reed]]|House Reed (Histories & Lore)}}
[[Image:Greywater Watch.png|thumb|right|200px|A map showing the location of Greywater Watch on the continent of Westeros.]]
[[File:Riverlands map.jpg|thumb|right|A map showing Greywater Watch with an incorrect name.]]
'''Greywater Watch''' is a castle in [[the Neck]]. It is ruled by [[House Reed]], a vassal house holding fealty to [[House Stark]] of [[Winterfell]]. Greywater Watch is nigh-untraceable because it moves.

It is the home of [[Jojen Reed|Jojen]] and [[Meera Reed]] and their father, Lord [[Howland Reed]]. It is the southernmost stronghold in [[the North]], and as such its rulers have a longstanding enmity with [[House Frey]] , who rule the area of the [[Riverlands]]Â on the southern side of the Neck.
sections.In the books:
In the ''[[A Song of Ice and Fire]]'' novels, Greywater Watch is the seat of House Reed, one of the most loyal vassals of the Starks. No raven can reach Greywater Watch because it is said to be constantly moving.

Greywater Watch has not been mentioned in the series yet except for a map that mistakenly refers to the settlement as 'Greytower Watch.'
